block.p: Mary Mills Conkey, a daughter of Jacqueline Peeler Conkey and Robert Beam Conkey of Statesville, N.C., was married last evening to Kevin Edward Fullington, a son of Marie Armstrong Fullington and Don Fullington of New York. The Rev. Thomas W. Corbell officiated at St. John's Lutheran Church in Statesville. The Rev. Joseph Barranger, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Fullington, 30, is known as Mollie. She is a vice president and an account executive at Linden Alschuler & Kaplan, a public relations firm in New York. She graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Her father is a regional sales manager for Mebane Packaging, in Mebane, N.C.

Mary Mills Conkey, a daughter of Jacqueline Peeler Conkey and Robert Beam Conkey of Statesville, N.C., was married last evening to Kevin Edward Fullington, a son of Marie Armstrong Fullington and Don Fullington of New York. The Rev. Thomas W. Corbell officiated at St. John's Lutheran Church in Statesville. The Rev. Joseph Barranger, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Fullington, 30, is known as Mollie. She is a vice president and an account executive at Linden Alschuler & Kaplan, a public relations firm in New York. She graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Her father is a regional sales manager for Mebane Packaging, in Mebane, N.C.

Mr. Fullington, 26, is the legal counsel to Thomas V. Ognibene, the Republican leader of the New York City Council. The bridegroom is also a member of the board of the Roosevelt Island Operating Corporation. He graduated magna cum laude from Providence College and received a law degree from Fordham University. His mother works in New York as the Irish Tourist Board's vice president for marketing and resources. His father is a freelance writer and the author of ''The Connoisseur's Guide to Ireland'' (Henry Holt, 1989).
